intro: Bertuchia, commonly known as golden ragwort, is a genus of flowering plants in the sunflower family. It consists of several species, most of which are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. These plants typically have basal leaves that are rhombic or ovate in shape, with a rough texture. The flowers are yellow and arranged in a composite head, typical of the Asteraceae family. Bertuchia species are often found in grasslands, meadows, and disturbed soils.
